title: From China Trade to Brexit, the Stock Market Had Plenty to Cheer About Last Week
text:
Murphy may be mistaken. his famous law asserts that whatever can go wrong, will. Well, things sometimes actually can go right.

Stocks rallied this past week, breaking their three-week losing streak, while the bond market’s much-feared economic barometer flipped to positive from negative. Progress appeared in an apparent de-escalation of the U.S.-China trade war. At the same time, global economic policies have turned from a headwind to a tailwind. Even the seemingly unending drag from Brexit might finally be coming to a less-than-disastrous...
description: Shares climb on apparently good portents for the global economy, U.S.-China trade, and Brexit. But that spelled bad news for bonds, whose long rally might be ending.
